thread.title: Map revealing Germany's WWII bombing targets is discovered | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Map revealing Germany's WWII bombing targets is discovered | Daily Mail Online

author: Sam Tonkin For Mailonline
title: Map revealing Germany's WWII bombing targets is discovered | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad Hitler's plans to destroy London: Rare mare map revealing Germany's WWII bombing targets is discovered after 75 years in an attic Map of Hitler's bombing targets during the Second World War has been unearthed after more than 75 years It belonged to a Luftwaffe navigator and highlights buildings and infrastructure in central and south London Notable German targets were Battersea Power Station, Chelsea Barracks and the Duke of Yorkâ€™s headquarters Map, dated from November 30, 1941, was found in the loft of a late WWII air gunner and is to be auctioned off
